DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of the study is to determine if a behavioral knowledge based education intervention will decrease medication transcription errors among professional nurses when admitting elder patients to a hospital. The hypothesis is those professional nurses who receive the behavioral-cognitive eduction medication taking intervention will have fewer medication errors than those professional nurses who do not.
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy of a Behavioral Based Education Intervention to Decrease Medication History Errors Among Professional Nurses.
DOC.criteria: Nurses working 20 hours a week or more Nurses working less than 20 hours a week Nurse working as a float or pool nurse
DOC.keyword: Reduction of admission medication history errors
